Process.Abstract: This algorithm generates a new vector layer with a single polygon representing the bounding box of an input vector layer.
Creates a new points layer with the centroids of the polygons in a given layer.
This algorithm inverts the ordering of vertices in a line, thus reversing its orientation.
This algorithm eliminates duplicated points. If several points with the same coordinates appear in a layer, the algorithm will leave just the first one of them, removing the remaining ones.

This algorithms checks the integrity of the attributes tables of a vector layer and removes invalid features (features with missing attributes or invalid values). The number of invalid features is shown in a message in the SEXTANTE log window.
This algorithm clips a vector layer using the polygons from an additional polygons layer.
This algorithm counts the points in each polygon of a given vector layer.
This algorithm creates a delaunay triangulation from a set of points.
This algorithm computes some geometric properties of the polygons in a given vector layer.
This algorithm computes some geometric properties of the lines in a given vector layer.
This algorithm generates a new points layer, taking all nodes from an input vector layer. Attributes of each point are taken from the geometry it belongs to.

This algorithm computes the intersection between two polygon vector layers. This is equivalent to a boolean AND operator. The geometries are altered and attributes table of the resulting layer contains as many fields as the union of both input attributes tables, as shown in the following picture.
This algorithm takes a points layer and generates a new layer with those same points, but adding two new fields (X and Y) to its attributes table, containing X and Y coordinates of each point
This algorithms converts a polygons layer into a polylines layer.
This algorithm converts polylines to polygons. Each polygon gets the attributes of the polyline it was created from.

This algorithm takes a lines layer and generates a new lines layer where each line has been substituted by a single segment (a line with just two nodes), which best approximate the direction and shape of the input line.

This algorithm removes holes from polygons in a polygon layer. A hole is an empty area within a polygon. Polygons with holes are defined as a envelope polygon (the outer contour) and a set of inner ones (the holes). This algorithm transform each polygon, removing those inner subpolygons and leaving just the outer one.

This algorithm separates those features that contains more than one single geometry. The resulting layer will contain each one of those geometries in a different feature. All features will share the same associated attributes.
